title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: outlines propose change ssdsims.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: Please note ssdsims project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: Thanks using ssdsims! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal ssdsims facilitate simulation studies species sensitivity distribution data.

title: Parameter Descriptions for Package — params
text: Default parameter descriptions may overridden individual functions.

title: Parameter Descriptions for Package — params
text: ... Unused. dist string specifying distribution fitdists object "top" use distribution weight "multi" treat distributions single distribution. nrow integer vector number rows generated data. nsim count number data sets generate. sims list simulated data. nseed count number new seeds get stream. return_items flag specifying whether return list generated items. save_to string existing directory save objects NULL. seed integer starting seed NULL. start_sim count number simulation start . start_seed count number seed start getting seeds . stream count stream number.

title: Parameter Descriptions for Package — params
text: flag non-missing logical scalar. string non-missing character scalar.

title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_fit_dists_sims
text: x data frame sim stream integer columns list column data frames fit distributions . dists character vector distribution names. ... Additional arguments passed ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(). seed integer starting seed NULL. silent flag indicating whether fits fail silently. save_to string existing directory save objects NULL.

text: x tibble list column fits fistdist objects.

title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_hc_sims
text: x data frame sim stream integer columns list column fitdists objects. proportion numeric vector proportion values estimate hazard concentrations . ... Additional arguments passed ssdtools::ssd_hc(). seed integer starting seed NULL. save_to NULL string specifying directory save bootstrap datasets parameter estimates (successfully converged) .

title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_hc_sims
text: x tibble list column hc data frames produced applying ssd_hc() fits.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
text: family functions generate tibble nested data sets.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
code: ssd_simulate_data(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   replace = FALSE,   nrow = 6L,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L )  # S3 method for class 'fitdists' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   dist = "top",   nrow = 6L,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L )  # S3 method for class 'tmbfit' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L )  # S3 method for class 'character' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   pars = list(),   nrow = 6L,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L )  # S3 method for class '`function`' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   args = list(),   nrow = 6L,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L )

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
text: x object use generating data. ... Unused. replace flag specifying whether sample replacement. nrow integer vector number rows generated data. seed integer starting seed NULL. nsim count number data sets generate. stream count stream number. start_sim count number simulation start . dist string specifying distribution fitdists object "top" use distribution weight "multi" treat distributions single distribution. pars named list parameter values. args named list argument values.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
text: tibble nested data sets.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
text: ssd_simulate_data(data.frame): Generate data data.frame ssd_simulate_data(fitdists): Generate data fitdists object ssd_simulate_data(tmbfit): Generate data tmbfit object ssd_simulate_data(character): Generate data using distribution name ssd_simulate_data(`function`): Generate data using function generate sequence random numbers

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
code: ssd_simulate_data(ssddata::ccme_boron, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> [1]       10407  -828974708 -1025162994 -1349237144   994348171   647900100 #> [7]  -930720105 #> [1]       10407   303994390 -1361337205  -477564388  -677446054    66148026 #> [7] -1066581325 #> [1]       10407   675886369  -925707542   313874480  1431848125   400795716 #> [7] -1532561531 #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>     sim stream data             #>   <int>  <int> <list>           #> 1     1      1 <tibble [5 × 5]> #> 2     2      1 <tibble [5 × 5]> #> 3     3      1 <tibble [5 × 5]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_simulate_data(fit, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>     sim stream data             #>   <int>  <int> <list>           #> 1     1      1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1 <tibble [5 × 1]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_simulate_data(fit[[1]], nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>     sim stream data             #>   <int>  <int> <list>           #> 1     1      1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1 <tibble [5 × 1]>  ssd_simulate_data("lnorm", nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>     sim stream data             #>   <int>  <int> <list>           #> 1     1      1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1 <tibble [5 × 1]>  ssd_simulate_data(ssdtools::ssd_rlnorm, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>     sim stream data             #>   <int>  <int> <list>           #> 1     1      1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1 <tibble [5 × 1]>
